page.title: 07The Sinclair C5 electric car
page.content: Earlier this year 1985 there was a rather special event in the Rhydycar Leisure Centre in Merthyr.Thousands of people turned up to see the Sinclair C5 electric car.This was being built at the local Hoover washing machine factory.Local people were really excited about this because if the car sold well it would mean new jobs for Merthyr.We queued for ages but at last were let in.As we went in we were given tee-shirts,hats and pens each with a picture of the C5 on the front.I was surprised when I saw the C5 it was made from a white plastic material.My father said the bodywork was made all in one piece so it was strong.It was very low and it had three wheels,one at the front and two behind.It had no steering wheel but a handlebar underneath the driver's legs It had no roof.
